question: 100 g of ice at <katex>$0^{\circ}C$</katex> is mixed with 100 g of water at <katex>$100^{\circ}C$</katex>. The final temperature of the mixture is [Take <katex>$L_{f}=3.36\times10^{5}J~kg^{-1}$</katex> and <katex>$S_{w}=4.2\times10^{3}J~kg^{-1}k^{-1}$</katex>]
explanation: Heat released by water cooling 100->T: <katex>$Q_1 = ms\Delta T = 0.1 \times 4200 \times (100-T) = 420(100-T)$</katex>.
Heat absorbed by ice melting: <katex>$Q_2 = mL = 0.1 \times 3.36 \times 10^5 = 33600 J$</katex>.
Heat absorbed by melted ice warming 0->T: <katex>$Q_3 = ms\Delta T = 0.1 \times 4200 \times (T-0) = 420T$</katex>.
